name: Outliner (Mark Sheeky)
description:
An arcade shooter game for Amiga & Amiga emulators. I originally released this game in 1996.

Outliner is an Asteroids-style action game for one or two players. It was an evolution of Roton, Xenex, and similar rotary shooters, here distinguished by two player co-op and combat modes, and the hi-res wireframe look. My 18th Amiga game, it was one of my last Amiga games and one of the most technically sophisticated. I remade this game for PC in 2002.

Supplied in ADF format for use with Amiga emulators, and in RP9 format for use with Cloanto's Amiga Forever and other RetroPlatform emulators.
